IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: Christ's Home operates residential facilities for children and senior adults in a Christian atmosphere dedicated to honoring the following principles: The Bible, People, Services, Stewardship and Benevolence.
IRS990.MissionDescription: The heart of Christ's Home is to serve the Lord by providing services to senior adults and disadvantaged children in an atmosphere graced with love, dignity, compassion and respect.
IRS990.Description: Children and Youth Services: To provide care and shelter for needy and neglected infants, children and teens by operating residential facilities. Christ's Home served 90 children in the past year. For this purpose, 23 volunteers donated 1,588 hours during the course of the year to benefit the children and youth services program. Services to teenage mothers and their babies were added in this past year.

Activity2.Description: Retirement Community: To provide for senior adults by operating a Continuing Care Retirement Community offering independent living, personal care and skilled nursing services. Christ's Home served 223 seniors this past year. For this purpose, 22 volunteers donated 2,824 hours during the course of the year to benefit senior programs. In this past year Independent Living Cottages and a Residential Clubhouse were completed.

OtherRevenueMisc.Description: Actuarial Gain on Post Employment Benefits Obligation

IRS990ScheduleA.GeneralExplanation: Other Income relates to telecommunications fees received by Christ's Home.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: Board designated endowment is for funding capital projects and expansion. Permanently restricted endowment proceeds are used for operational expenses, to the extent permissible by law.

Christ's Home files Federal Form 990 and has not filed a Form 990T. With a few exceptions, Christ's Home is no longer subject to US federal, state or local income tax examinations by taxing authorities for years before 2007. It is difficult to predict the final timing and resolution of any particular uncertain tax position. Based on Christ's Home's assessment of many factors, including past experience and complex judgements about future events, Christ's Home does not currently anticipate significant changes in its uncertain tax positions over the next 12 months.

Form990ScheduleLPartIV.Relationship: Family Member of R Smyth, Key Employee
Family Member of R Smyth, Key Employee

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: A draft of the 990 is provided to the Finance Committee of the Board of Trustees for review. It is then forwarded to all members of the Board of Trustees for review and approval. After the Trustees' approval, it is filed with the IRS.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 12c
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: On an annual basis, each trustee and key employee must complete and sign a Conflict of Interest Statement. In addition, all are required to seek Board approval, on an intervening basis for any potential related party transactions. In addition, the interested party is required to recluse him/herself from voting on any related party transaction.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 15
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: All compensation is established during the annual budgeting process. The budget is submitted to Finance Committee of the Board of Trustees and then to the Full Board for approval. Christ's Home engaged a consultant in researching and implementing pay grades and incentives for key employees. Also, to support compensation, salary surveys relevant to Christ's Home programs are reviewed. Specifically, surveys published by PANPHA (A Pennsylvania Association of Non Profit Senior Services) and PCCYFS (Pennsylvania Council of Children, Youth and Family Services) are utilized to assess comparability of compensation for the CEO and top management. This process is substantiated through contemporaneous minutes prepared for all committee and Board meetings.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, Line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The governing documents and financial statements are filed with Commonwealth of Pennsylvania Department of State on an annual basis and can be accessed by contacting them directly. In addition, the governing documents, Conflice of Interest Policy and Financial Statements are made available to the public by Christ's Home upon request.
During the tax year, one trustee served with entity doing business with the organization. These transactions do not meet the reporting requirements for disclosure on Schedule L.

ReasonableCauseExplanation.Explanation: Audited financial statements were not yet available.
